snippet: The stock prices of Smith & Wesson and Sturm, Ruger have each risen more than shares of Apple since 2009, driven by surging sales linked to fears of regulation.
abstract: Investment firms that bet heavily on shares of leading gun manufacturers Smith & Wesson and Sturm, Ruger & Co have seen those bets pay off, as gun sales have spiked after Paris and San Bernardino, Calif, terrorist attacks, and in wake of Pres Obama's announcement of measures to stop gun violence; while some investors merely missed opportunity, others have intentionally avoided such stocks, considering them taboo.
lead_paragraph: The stock prices of Smith & Wesson and Sturm, Ruger have each risen more than shares of Apple since 2009, driven by surging sales linked to fears of regulation.

headline.main: After Mass Shootings, Some on Wall St. See Gold in Gun Makers
headline.print_headline: After Shootings, Spotting Gold in Gun Makers
